metadata.Title: CVE-2012-2666 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
golang/go in 1.0.2 fixes all.bash on shared machines. dotest() insrc/pkg/debug/gosym/pclntab_test.go creates a temporary file withpredicable name and executes it as shell script.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-2666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

golang-1.8 - 1.0.2
golang-1.8-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.8-src - 1.0.2
libgolang-1.8-std1 - 1.0.2
No subscription required

golang-1.9 - 1.0.2
golang-1.9-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.9-src - 1.0.2
No subscription required

golang-1.10 - 1.0.2
golang-1.10-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.10-src - 1.0.2
No subscription required

golang-1.13 - 1.0.2
golang-1.13-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.13-src - 1.0.2
No subscription required

golang-1.16 - 1.0.2
golang-1.16-go - 1.0.2
golang-1.16-src - 1.0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: golang-1.8 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2').
golang-1.9 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0.2').
